bibl.title: Gus Bendjus et al. v. Territory of Washington. Attendant.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.head: Territory Wash vs. G Bendjus et al, Attendant
div1.p: Bynold and Robinson, Attys for Defendant

In the district court of the Second Judicial District fo Washington Territory
Territory of Washington vs G. Bendjus et al
Territory of Washington County of Chehalis} Attendant

Lewis B Bynold being first duly sworn on Oath says that, C Holberg, W H Amedon, and G I Roderich were Grand Jurors at the last September term of the District Court for Chehalis County, that they each of them told this affiant during the week last past that one John I Medcalf was remanded as a Witness before said Grand Jury when the three cases wherein the Territory of Washington plaintiff and G Bendjus et al are defendants was being investigated by them that his testimony was given before them previous to the indictment being filed in open court that he, the said Medcalf was subpoenaed on behalf of the Territory of Washington and gave evidence relating to the cases aforesaid, that said John Medcalf name no where appears on any of the three said indictments, now on file in the aforesaid court.
Subscribed and sworn to before the 10 day of Oct 1887
Mason Irwin, Notary Public, Wash. Ter.
